page.title: 01GAZETTEER - ELLOUGHTON AREA
page.content: The main feature of the block is its rural nature. The south and west are low lying and flat being part of the River Humber flood plain, whilst to the north east the land rises fairly steeply up te scarp slope of the wolds from about 20m to 120m in the space of 1km. Away from the poorly drained areas along the river's southerly aspect, rich alluvium soil and the drier chalk soils have given rise to intensive horticulture and a variety of high yield farm crops. Passing through the block in a general east_west direction are the major road, rail and river communications from Hull. The major residential area of Elloughton/Brough covering some one and a half square kilometres is centrally situated, whilst to the east is the small village of Welton.
